alert.note: Alert for Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 27 at 8:51AM MDT until further notice by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Montana... Little Bighorn River Near Hardin affecting Big Horn County. .Water levels may remain near flood stage over the next few days due to recent heavy rain. In addition, high flows on the Bighorn River may back up the Little Bighorn River at the confluence causing flooding in the Hardin vicinity. Whether flooding develops will depend on additional rainfall upstream over the next few days along with any additional increase in flow on the Bighorn River this week. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Little Bighorn River near Hardin. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM MDT Tuesday the stage was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...River levels will be near flood stage based on the latest information. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Little Bighorn River Hardin 8.0 7.5 Tue 8 am 6.9 5.8 5.4 &&
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means that flooding is possible. Now is the time to prepare for action in the event flooding occurs. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning by 900 AM MDT.
